text: !important :slightly_smiling_face: … finding syntax of things using the HubL documentation is a pain … is there a documentation for developers … i mean not a general help section that searches the blogs and everything … 99% of the times i need help, as a developer, is proper spelling and syntaxes of thing, like is it overwrite=false or is it no-overwrite=true … things like this … or maybe is just me
it toke me 10 min (this happens every time) to find my answer (overrideable=False) by using the browsers find on page feature on the blog marckup
yeah..would be nice to limit the scope of the search
(throwing on your radar <@U6W3H6YN8>)

Thanks for the feedback <@U2PDTMH53> - sorry it's been frustrating to find the docs you're looking for.

We're exploring how to improve documentation in 2019 and took this down as a note. :slightly_smiling_face:

*You're Invited* :envelope_with_arrow: Come join us for our HubSpot Developer AMA with the HubSpot product team.
> See where the product team is headed and ask your CMS and API questions!

The AMA is *this Wednesday (Dec 12th) at 12PM EST*
Save your spot here :point_right: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/developer-ama-2>

blog from HubSpot ```Recommended: They also advise you to use an image smaller than 180 x 110 pixels that is close to that aspect ratio (i.e. rectangular, rather than square). This is because they always present the thumbnail image as 180 x 110 pixels in people's LinkedIn feeds no matter what image size you upload.```
oops
vs linked in `Minimum image dimensions: 1200 (w) x 627 (h) pixels`
what size should i use in the meta og:image
are you referring to these types of images:
yeah
according to the source, it looks like the images are shown at 552 x 289
ok.  will give it a shot
thanks
for our blog feat images i do 800x400
that seems to scale pretty good for all the social stuff
ex from linkedn in
i do like those letters
but the damn client…
facebook image
i will trust you
id go with 800x400 and then the system will always scale down
hasnt messed up for us yet
ok
thanks again
there’s our problem
<@UD53A9UUR> Here's the template i use with guides. I made a green box to show the "safe area"

I've noticed when using the template that text or items that fall on the outside of those will sometimes look awkwards (like on a galaxy s9 with the beveled screen) so keeping text within the main box should be fine
top and bottom areas dont matter as much as we often have graphics that go above those but I always keep out text inside that area
I would say for that logo, just do a still of the sky/city bg from the homepage video with a whitewash on it and then the logo over it in middle
or fancy with a bg gif thats washed :wink:
fancy, eh
that is above my pay grade
and another reason <@UDC5GRX6E> would fire me immediately
Does anyone have any clever methods in order to add a custom CSS class on an <li> generated by the advanced menu module?
just that one or all?
and by clever….

yea, it’s super clever, can’t take credit for it though, it was invented back in the 90's they call it javascript.

(sorry had to joke, it’s one of those days)

For real though, loop through the li’s and add the classes you need as you need them.
$(function(){$('.hs-menu-item.hs-menu-depth-1.hs-item-has-children').addClass('ADD-CUSTOM-CLASS-HERE')})
sorry dennis, alert() doesn't work in IE, has to be window.alert(), you're fired
HA
<@UD53A9UUR> Ideally just one, but I could select which one
<@UDC5GRX6E> Awesome! Thank you
Hey folks, here is an update on the plans for the ‘old’ Design Manager -> <https://designers.HubSpot.com/blog/access-to-the-old-design-manager-will-be-removed-on-1/30/19>

We are putting the finishing touches on global smart content for modules in the new Design Manager which should be live to all this week. That is one remaining feature to have parity. Once that is released there should be no reason to use the old tool(other than change is hard). Everything works in the new tool and users do NOT have to upgrade v1 modules to use the new Design Manager.
hi, i would like to have the name of my topic at the top of my topic pages. here is what i have so far <https://www.aboutoliveoil.org/topic/olive-oil-quality>
i tried {% if topic %}<h3>Posts about {{ page_meta.html_title|replace(' | ', '') }}</h3>{% endif %} but it puts the title tag of the page
how do i just have it list the topic name?

1 method use content.absolute_url and strip out  `<https://www.aboutoliveoil.org/topic/>`
then  |replace(“-”,” “)|title
voila, simple topic title generated by the slug
oooh.. ok. thanks!!!

Is there a place where can request additional Developer Info to be added? I feel like it would be a good addition to have both the `{{topic}}` and then a var called `{{topic_name}}` that does the above code.
Also, there really should be a KB about all the different vars that are available in the Dev info
i'd be happy to contribute to it and even start a git for it
kb?
knowledge base
agreed and I would be right there with ya, though I don’t like the idea of duplicating the HubSpot official documentation basically. It’d be nice to be able to augment the official stuff
had planned to make the dev extension be able to do that. just never had the time to fully dev it out. the concept is in the github issues for it.
ultimately Open Source HubSpot Dev docs is the solution that makes the most sense to me
